info.title: Commercial Project - Create, Update
info.description:
The service enables you to do the following:
 - Create and manage customer and internal projects
 - Manage work packages and work items
 - Plan resources and expenses in work packages
 - Staff resources to work packages
 - Create, read, and update sales orders for your customer projects

x-sap-shortText: Create and update commercial projects using this synchronous inbound service

values.text: [Internal Project Management - Project-Based Services(1A8)](https://me.sap.com/processnavigator/SolP/1A8 " Link To BP ")
[Customer Project Management - Project-Based Services(J11)](https://me.sap.com/processnavigator/SolP/J11 " Link To BP ")

x-sap-extensible.description:
API can be extended by custom fields on the following business contexts (field usage for this API needs to be selected):
* Engagement Project (/CPD/CUSTOMER_PROJECT)
* Work Package (/CPD/CUST_PROJ_WORKPACKAGE)
* Sales: Sales Document (SD_SALESDOC)
* Sales: Sales Document Item (SD_SALESDOCITEM)

[How to add an extension field to an API](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/ce819b8557194ae0aa180ba4ac6a04de.html)

get.summary: Reads all sales order headers in customer projects.
get.description: Reads the header data of all sales orders related to customer projects in the system.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates a sales order for a customer project.
post.description: Creates a sales order header for a customer project using deep insert requests. This means consumers can create a sales order with all possible sub-entities (for example, header partners or items).

get.summary: Reads the header of a specific sales order in a customer project.
get.description: Reads the header data of a specific sales order in a customer project. Consumers must pass the following key fields: customer project ID and sales order ID.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.summary: Updates the header of a specific sales order in a customer project.
patch.description: Updates the header data of a specific sales order in a customer project. Consumers must pass the following key fields: customer project ID and sales order ID.

get.summary: Reads all sales order items in a specific customer project.
get.description: Reads all item data of a sales order in a specific customer project. Consumers must pass the customer project ID (key field).

parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

post.summary: Creates a sales order item for a specific customer project.
post.description: Creates a sales order item using a deep insert request (an item plus a work package assignment plus optionally one billing plan item or text) in a customer project.

get.summary: Returns all team-related resource demands in work packages of customer and internal projects.
get.description: Returns all team-related resource demands in work packages of customer and internal projects. Since this operation is likely to return a large result set, it is recommended that you also use filters to retrieve only the required results. Note that you can retrieve information both from the current version (version 1) and the baseline version (version 2).

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates a resource demand for a work package team.
post.description:
Creates a resource demand for a work package team. You can also use this request to specify effort distribution for the resource demand and create a resource supply and specify its distribution. Note that creation of new entries is allowed in the current version (version 1) only.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns details about a specific resource demand in a work package.
get.description: Returns details about a specific resource demand in a work package. Note that you can retrieve information both from the current version (version 1) and the baseline version (version 2).

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.summary: Updates information for a resource demand.
patch.description:
Updates information for a resource demand. Note that you can update information for the current version (version 1) only.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

delete.summary: Deletes a resource demand in a work package.
delete.description:
Deletes a resource demand and the associated demand distribution, demand supply, and supply distribution, in the current version (version 1) of a work package.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns details about the effort distribution for a specific resource demand.
get.description: Returns details about the effort distribution for a specific resource demand in a work package. Note that you can retrieve information both from the current version (version 1) and the baseline version (version 2).

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

post.summary: Creates distribution of efforts for a resource demand in a work package.
post.description:
Creates distribution of efforts for a resource demand in a work package. You can also use this request to create a resource supply and its distribution across the months of the work package. Note that creation of new entries is allowed in the current version (version 1) only.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns information about the skills assigned to a specific resource demand.
get.description: Returns information about the skills assigned to a specific resource demand in a work package. Note that you can retrieve information only from the current version (version 1).

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

get.summary: Returns details about confirmed staffing assignments for a resource demand.
get.description: Returns details about confirmed staffing assignments for a resource demand. Note that you can retrieve information from the current version (version 1) and the baseline version (version 2).

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

post.summary: Creates a resource supply for a resource demand in a work package.
post.description:
Creates a supply for a resource demand in a work package. You can also use this request to distribute the effort of the resource supply across months of the work package. Note that creation of new entries is allowed in the current version (version 1) only.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns details about demand distributions for resource demands in the system.
get.description: Returns details about demand distributions for resource demands in the system. Since this operation is likely to return a large result set, it is recommended that you also use filters to retrieve only the required results. Note that you can retrieve information both from the current version (version 1) and the baseline version (version 2).

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates a new distribution for a resource demand in a work package.
post.description:
Creates new distribution for a resource demand in a work package. You can also simultaneously create a resource supply and its distribution. Note that you can create new entries only in the current version (version 1).

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns details about effort distribution in a resource demand, for a given month and year.
get.description: Returns details about effort distribution in a resource demand, for a given month and year. You can retrieve information from both the current version (version 1) and the baseline version (version 2).

parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.summary: Updates a demand distribution for a resource demand in a work package.
patch.description:
Updates a demand distribution for a resource demand in a work package. Note that you can create new entries only in the current version (version 1).

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

delete.summary: Deletes a demand distribution item from a resource demand in a work package.
delete.description:
Deletes a demand distribution item from a resource demand in a work package. Note that you can delete a resource demand distribution item only from the current version (version 1).

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns information about the resource demand for an item in the demand distribution.
get.description: Returns information about the resource demand for an item in the demand distribution. Note that you can retrieve information from the current version (version 1) and the baseline version (version 2).

get.summary: Returns skills assigned to resource demands in all work packages.

get.description: Returns all resource supplies and their distribution in work packages of customer and internal projects. Since this operation is likely to return a large result set, it is recommended that you also use filters to retrieve only the required results. Note that you can retrieve information both from the current version (version 1) and the baseline version (version 2).

post.summary: Creates a resource supply for a resource demand in a work package.
post.description:
Creates a resource supply for a resource demand in a work package. You can also use this request to specify the effort distribution across the duration of the resource demand. Note that creation of new entries is allowed in the current version (version 1) only.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns details about a specific resource supply in a work package.
get.description: Returns details about a specific resource supply in a work package. Note that you can retrieve information both from the current version (version 1) and the baseline version (version 2).

Updates information for a resource supply. Note that you can update information for the current version (version 1) only.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

delete.summary: Deletes a resource supply in a work package.
delete.description:
Deletes a resource supply and the associated supply distribution, in the current version (version 1) of a work package.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns information about the resource demand for a confirmed staffing assignment.
get.description: Returns information about the resource demand for a confirmed staffing assignment. Note that you can retrieve information from the current version (version 1) and the baseline version (version 2).

Creates distribution of efforts for a resource supply in a work package. You can also use this request to distribute the effort across the months of the work package. Note that creation of new entries is allowed in the current version (version 1) only.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

post.description:
Creates new distribution for a resource supply in a work package. Note that you can create new entries only in the current version (version 1).

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns details about effort distribution in a resource supply, for a given month and year.
get.description: Returns details about effort distribution in a resource supply, for a given month and year. You can retrieve information from both the current version (version 1) and the baseline version (version 2).

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.summary: Updates a supply distribution for a resource supply in a work package.
patch.description:
Updates a supply distribution for a resource supply in a work package. Note that you can create new entries only in the current version (version 1).

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

delete.summary: Deletes a supply distribution item from a resource supply in a work package.
delete.description:
Deletes a supply distribution item from a resource supply in a work package. Note that you can delete a resource suppy distribution item only from the current version (version 1).

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns information about a resource supply for a given supply distribution.
get.description: Returns information about a resource supply for a given supply distribution. Note that you can retrieve information both from the current version (version 1) and the baseline version (version 2).

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

get.summary: Returns the work package functions in work packages of customer and internal projects.
get.description: Returns information about work package functions and their status. It also retrieves information such as the work package ID, project ID, work package function, its description, and whether the work package function is blocked or allowed in the work package. Since this operation is likely to return a large result set, it is recommended that you also use filters to retrieve only the required results.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Sets the status of a work package function in a work package.
post.description:
Sets the status of a work package function to allow or block actual postings in a work package.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns information about a work package function in the work package of a customer or internal project.
get.description: Returns information about a work package function in a work package. It retrieves information such as the work package function name and whether it is blocked or allowed.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.summary: Updates the status of a work package function in a work package.
patch.description:
Updates the status of a work package function to allow or block actual postings in a work package.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns details about customer and internal projects.
get.description: Returns details about all customer and internal projects in the system.  Besides retrieving basic information, it also retrieves information such as business partners assigned to project roles, the work packages and resources planned in a project, and staffing assignments.  Since this operation is likely to return a large result set, it is recommended that you also use filters to retrieve only the required results.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates a customer or internal project.
post.description:
Creates a customer or internal project based on the level of information you provide. You can create a project by providing basic inputs to the ProjectSet. As an alternative, you may also create a project by providing inputs to nested entities such as project roles, work packages, work items, resource demands, and work package functions. 

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns details about a customer or internal project.
get.description: Returns details about a customer or internal project. Using the project ID, you can retrieve information such as business partners assigned to project roles, the work packages and resources planned in a project, and staffing assignments.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.summary: Updates the basic information for a customer or internal project.
patch.description:
Updates the basic information for a customer or internal project. You can only update certain information such as project name, description, start and end dates, the project manager, project controller, project accountant, project partner, and settings such as confidentiality and time posting. Changes to information such as the project stage, profit center, and currency are possible with certain restrictions. 

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns, for a project, the project roles and the business partners assigned to those roles.
get.description: Returns all the project roles and the business partner assigned to each role, for a given customer or internal project.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates project roles for a customer or internal project.
post.description:
Creates project roles for a customer or internal project. You can also assign a business partner along with the creation of a project role. 

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns work packages and their details, for a given customer or internal project.
get.description: Returns the work packages and corresponding details, for a given customer or internal project. Besides retrieving details about a work package, it also retrieves information from related entities such as work package functions, work items, planned resources, and staffed resources.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates work packages for an internal or customer project.
post.description:
Creates work packages for an internal or customer project. You can either create a work packages by providing inputs to the WorkPackageSet. As an alternative, you may also create work packages by providing inputs to nested entities such as work items, resource demands, and work package functions. 

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns information about work packages in customer and internal projects.
get.description: Returns information such as the work package name, work package type, start and end dates, assigned work items, the resource plan, work package functions and their status, and when the work package was last changed. Since this operation is likely to return a large result set, it is recommended that you also use filters to retrieve only the required results.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates a work package for a customer or internal project.
post.description:
Creates a work package for a customer or internal project. Do not enter a work package ID since an automated number format is used. You must enter the basic details such as dates and work package type. You may also create optional information by providing the relevant inputs for nested entities such as work items, resource demands, and work package functions. Since this operation is likely to return a large result set, it is recommended that you also use filters to retrieve only the required results. 

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns information about a specific work package in a customer or internal project.
get.description: Returns detailed information about a work package and information from corresponding nested entities such as work items, resource demands, and work package functions.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.summary: Updates basic information for a work package.
patch.description:
Updates basic information such as the work package description and dates. For a service-based work package, you can also update the service quantity.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

delete.summary: Deletes a work package in a customer or internal project.
delete.description:
Deletes a work package in a customer or internal project. Note that a work package can be deleted only if there are no actual postings.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns details about team resources planned in a work package.
get.description: Returns details about team resources planned in a work package. Note that this request does not return information about additional resources and expenses planned in a work package.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates a resource demand for a specific work package.
post.description:
Creates a resource demand for a specific work package. You can also use this request to specify effort distribution for the resource demand and create a resource supply and specify its distribution.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns header information for the project of a work package.
get.description: Returns header information such as project dates, project stage, project roles, and accounting details.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

get.summary: Returns all the work items assigned to a work package.
get.description: Returns all the work items assigned to the work package of a customer or internal project.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Assigns work items to a work package.
post.description:
Assigns work items to a work package. You can use this operation to assign pre-defined work items that are already configured in your S/4HANA Cloud system or create new user-defined work items for the work package. To create and assign user-defined work items, provide only the work item name since the system generates a unique ID when the assignment is successful. Also note that user-defined work item IDs cannot be reused across work packages. 

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns all the resources and expenses planned in a work package.
get.description: Returns all the resources and expenses planned in the work package of a customer or internal project.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates a resource plan for a work package.
post.description:
Creates a resource plan for a work package. You can create plan items for people and additional resources by providing details such as the resource type, resource, and planned effort or quantity. You can also plan expenses by providing the planned cost and revenue. You may use the billing control category property to indicate if a plan item is billable or not. 

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns the status of all work package functions in a work package.
get.description: Returns the status of all work package functions in the work package of a customer or internal project.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Sets the status of a work package function in a work package.
post.description:
Sets the status of a work package function. You can use this operation to block work package functions and thereby disallow the posting of certain costs to the work package. 

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns the work items assigned to a work package.
get.description: Returns the work items assigned to a work package. It also retrieves information such as the work package ID, work item ID, and the description. Since this operation is likely to return a large result set, it is recommended that you also use filters to retrieve only the required results.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Assign a work item to a work package.
post.description:
Assigns a standard work item to a work package. You can also create user-defined work items. Note that user-defined work items are valid only for a specific work package.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns information about a work item in a work package.
get.description: Returns information about a work item in a work package. You can retrieve information such as the name of the work item and its description.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

delete.summary: Deletes a work item from a work package.
delete.description:
Deletes a work item from a work package. If a work item has been planned for a resource, it is not deleted but marked inactive. Moreover, you can only delete work items if there are no actual postings for it in the work package. 

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns items planned in work packages of customer and internal projects.
get.description: Returns items planned in work packages of customer and internal projects. You can retrieve plan items such as demands for people and additional resources, and expenses. Since this operation is likely to return a large result set, it is recommended that you also use filters to retrieve only the required results.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates a resource plan item in a work package.
post.description:
Creates a resource plan item in a work package. You can use this operation to plan items for which you need people, additional resources, or expenses, and plan if the item will be billed or not.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns details about a specific item planned in a work package.
get.description: Returns details about a specific item planned in a work package. You can retrieve information about a specific plan item such as a demand for people, additional resources, or expenses. If there are several records with identical values in key fields, the response is a set of aggregated records with planned efforts  or quantities grouped by a list of predefined criteria such as resource type, resource, work item, delivery organization,  and billing control category.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.summary: Updates a plan item in a work package.
patch.description:
Updates a plan item in a work package, with information about the billing control category and quantity. For expenses, you can update the planned cost and revenue.  If there are several records with identical values in key fields, the service returns an error.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

delete.summary: Deletes a plan item from a work package.
delete.description:
Deletes a plan item from a work package. Note that you cannot delete a plan item if a corresponding cost posting has been made.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns the project roles and business partners assigned to them.
get.description: Returns details about the roles assigned to a project and the business partner assigned to each role. Since this operation is likely to return a large result set, it is recommended that you also use filters to retrieve only the required results.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Assigns a project role and a business partner to a project.
post.description:
Assigns a business partner to a standard or user-defined project role.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

get.summary: Returns the business partner assigned to a project role.
get.description: Returns the business partner assigned to a project role in a customer or internal project. It retrieves information such as the ID and name of the business partner.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.summary: Updates the business partner assigned to a project role.
patch.description:
Updates the business partner assigned to a standard or user-defined project role.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

delete.summary: Deletes an assigned project role from a project.
delete.description:
Deletes an assigned project role from a project. Note that deletion of the project manager role is not allowed.

A changeset of a $batch request must process records that belong only to one project or sales order.

post.summary: Invoke action updateCustProjSlsOrdItemMaterial

parameters.name: CustomerProject
parameters.description: Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes

parameters.name: SalesOrderItem
parameters.description: Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes

parameters.name: Material
parameters.description: Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes

post.summary: Send a group of requests
post.description:
Group multiple requests into a single request payload, see [Batch Requests](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=152).

*Please note that "Try it out" is not supported for this request.*

GET A_CustProjSlsOrd HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json


--request-separator--
